## Introduction

For visually impaired people, accessing digital content can be a challenge. That's where screen readers come in. One such tool is called NVDA (NonVisual Desktop Access), which is a free and open source screen reader. In this article, we'll introduce you to the features and benefits of NVDA.

## Features of NVDA

NVDA provides a range of features to make it easier for visually impaired people to access digital content. Here are some of the key features:

### Text-to-speech

NVDA uses synthesized speech to read out the text on a computer screen. Users can customize the voice and speed of the speech to suit their individual preferences.

### Braille

NVDA also supports output to refreshable braille displays. This can be an important feature for users who have both visual and hearing impairments.

### Keyboard navigation

NVDA provides keyboard shortcuts for navigating around the screen, allowing users to quickly access different parts of a webpage or application.

### Support for popular applications

NVDA works well with many popular applications, including web browsers, email clients, and office productivity suites.

## Benefits of NVDA

Here are some of the key benefits of using NVDA:

### Cost

NVDA is completely free to use. For people who have limited financial resources, this can be a huge advantage over other commercial screen readers that can be expensive.

### Open source

NVDA is open source software. This means that developers can access the source code and contribute to the project, making it a community effort.

### Easy to use

NVDA is designed to be easy to use for people who are new to screen readers. It comes with a range of tutorials and documentation to help users get started quickly.

### Accessibility

NVDA is highly accessible, with support for many different languages and braille displays. This makes it a valuable tool for people around the world.

## Conclusion

NVDA is a free and open source screen reader that provides a range of features to help visually impaired people access digital content. Its low cost, open source nature, ease of use, and accessibility make it a valuable tool for people around the world. If you or someone you know could benefit from a screen reader, consider giving NVDA a try.
